DataElement.preferredName: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) Last Two Weeks How Often Trouble Sleeping Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often over the last 2 weeks they have been bothered by trouble falling or staying asleep or sleeping too much, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 Item Last Two Weeks How Often Trouble Sleeping Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 9-item scale using each of the 9 DSM-IV criteria with self-reported frequency of "0" (not at all) to "3" (nearly every day). One of the most widely used instruments to assess depression, PHQ-9 scores of 5, 10, 15, and 20 represent mild, moderate, moderately severe, and severe depression, respectively._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._Any period of seven consecutive days._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_A question about whether an individual has or had trouble sleeping._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey developed and published by Kurt Kroenke, Robert Spitzer and Janet Williams in 2001 in the Journal of General Internal Medicine which is used to measure the severity of an individual's depression symptoms. This instrument contains 9 items with a follow-up question that is not part of the scoring. Each item is rated on a scale of 0-3 with 0 being 'not at all' and 3 being 'nearly every day.'

Concepts.definition: A 9-item scale using each of the 9 DSM-IV criteria with self-reported frequency of "0" (not at all) to "3" (nearly every day). One of the most widely used instruments to assess depression, PHQ-9 scores of 5, 10, 15, and 20 represent mild, moderate, moderately severe, and severe depression, respectively.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not quite or just short of.: Including all possibilities or occurring at regular intervals.: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
